required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Chewing the Tapioca Pearls in Bubble Tea Drinks
clinical_study.official_title: Quality Improvement of Saliva by Chewing Tapioca Pearls in Bubble Tea Drinks

brief_summary.textblock: Bubble tea drinks contain tea and tapioca pearls. Chewing tapioca pearls in bubble tea drinks may increase salivary components. Because of its proteins, inorganic components, and enzymes, saliva plays an important role in the body's defense against bacteria and viruses. This study aims to analyze the effect of chewing the tapioca pearls in bubble tea drinks on salivary C-reactive protein (CRP) and calcium (Ca) levels.

detailed_description.textblock: Sixty saliva samples were collected from 15 subjects. The inclusion criterion was 18-25 years of age. The exclusion criteria were receiving medication, using dentures, a history of dry mouth, smoking and systemic disease. In the first week of the experiment, subjects drank bubble tea as the intervention group. In the second week, the same subjects drank tea without pearls as the control group. Each subject drank the bubble tea for 5 minutes per day over 3 days. Saliva samples were collected on the first day before bubble tea consumption (pretest) and on the third day after tea consumption (posttest). Saliva collection was performed in the morning (09:00 a.m.-12:00 p.m.) for 1 minute. Salivary CRP levels were measured using an ELISA kit, and Ca levels were determined using a test kit.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: In the first week of the experiment, subject chewing tapioca pearl inthe bubble tea. In the second week, the same subjects drink tea without chewing tapioca pearl

primary_outcome.description: Salivary CRP level was measured on the first day before chewing tapioca peals in the bubble tea drinks and drink tea. Salivary CRP level was measured on the third day after drink bubble tea and tea without tapioca pearls

secondary_outcome.description: Ca level was measured on the first day before chewing tapioca peals in the bubble tea drinks and drink tea. Ca level was measured on the third day after drink bubble tea and tea without tapioca pearls

arm_group.arm_group_label: chewing tapioca pearls in the bubble tea drinks
arm_group.description: In the first week, the subjects drink as much as 100 ml of bubble tea over a span of 5 minutes once a day for 3 days

arm_group.arm_group_label: drink tea without chewing tapioca pearls
arm_group.description: In the second week, the subjects drink tea without tapioca pearls as much as 100 ml for 5 minutes per day for 3 days.

intervention.intervention_name: chewing tapioca pearls in bubble tea drinks
intervention.description: Saliva was collected on the first day before bubble tea consumption (pretest) and on the third day after bubble tea consumption (posttest); collection was conducted in the morning (09:00 a.m.-12.00 p.m.).
intervention.arm_group_label: chewing tapioca pearls in the bubble tea drinks

intervention.intervention_name: drink tea without chewing tapioca pearls
intervention.description: Saliva was collected on the first day before drink tea without tapioca pearl (pretest) and on the third day after tea consumption (posttest); collection was conducted in the morning (09:00 a.m.-12.00 p.m.).
intervention.arm_group_label: drink tea without chewing tapioca pearls

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- good Oral Hygiene Index-Simplified (OHI-S) score
Exclusion Criteria:
- taking medication
- a history of dry mouth
- smoking
- systemic disease

overall_official.affiliation: Faculty of Dentistry, Universitas Gadjah Mada

facility.name: Faculty of Dentistry, Universitas Gadjah Mada

link.description: Elevated salivary C-reactive protein levels are associated with active and passive smoking in healthy youth: A pilot study

responsible_party.investigator_title: Quality improvement of saliva by chewing tapioca pearls in bubble tea drinks
